channel.title: Help!@
channel.description:
mhey guys when i run client it say's 'java' is not reconised as a internal or oxternal command
what do i do?? >:P

item.title: Help!@
item.dc:creator: @chaotic_twin chaotic twin
item.description:
@chaotic_twin wrote:

[quote=“gergy008, post:2, topic:410062”]This is because java isn’t installed properly

If you have just installed java or the jdk restart your PC and it should be fine. Try restarting anyway.

Alternatively you will have to Google ‘How to add environment variables’ and point that to your java installation folder, Probably C:\Program Files\Java\jre6[/quote]
so i redownload jdk 36 then restaqrt comp then i should work? do you have skype? or msn?

Read full topic

item.title: Help!@
item.dc:creator: @gergy008 gergy008
item.description:
@gergy008 wrote:

Even with JRE, it still tries to install the environment variable (Just ‘java’ from the command line)

Read full topic

item.title: Help!@
item.dc:creator: @demps2k9 demps2k9
item.description:
@demps2k9 wrote:

JDK is unneeded to run a client. You only need JRE and there’s no need to restart either.

Read full topic

item.title: Help!@
item.dc:creator: @gergy008 gergy008
item.description:
@gergy008 wrote:

This is because java isn’t installed properly

If you have just installed java or the jdk restart your PC and it should be fine. Try restarting anyway.

Alternatively you will have to Google ‘How to add environment variables’ and point that to your java installation folder, Probably C:\Program Files\Java\jre6

Read full topic
